page.title: 02INDUSTRY
page.content: The austin-rover site at longbridge cover 260 acres. It was orginally started by Herbert Austin in 1905 in a derelict printing works 7 miles out -side birmingham. Part of the land was disused railway cuttings, part of the land was rented form birmingham corporation. The site itself wasn't really ideal for manufacture because of all the hills that it incorporates and a lot of expence and effort had to be put into transporting the various components about the factory. The range of cars include the mini which has been produced for 26 years, the rover for 2 years and the metro for 5 years. The total employees in 1985 was 11.5 thousand compared with 22,000 in 1974. The factory is in the main assembly line. Most of it is automated and computerised but workers still finish the product off.
